categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several pull requests have been submitted to the elizaOS/eliza repository, focusing on various improvements and fixes:

1. Bug fixes and type declarations:
   - PR #3898 and #3895 by wtfsayo address core type declarations and DTS generation issues
   - PR #3903 by RiverZ-pingu fixes a typo in the core packages

2. Feature enhancements:
   - PR #3902 by tcm390 adds client WSS (WebSocket Secure) functionality
   - PR #3907 by tcm390 implements GUI thumbnail features
   - PR #3908 by wtfsayo adds UI display for agent actions and runtime logs
   - PR #3905 by jmikedupont2 introduces local autodoc functionality

3. Documentation improvements:
   - PR #3906 by madjin performs a major cleanup of the documentation

These contributions demonstrate ongoing development efforts to enhance functionality, fix issues, and improve documentation in the Eliza project.

Several bugfixes have been implemented in recent pull requests to the ElizaOS repository. PR #3898 fixed core DTS generation, PR #3915 addressed a Discord plugin error, and PR #3913 resolved a migration race condition.

New features have been added to ElizaOS. PR #3910 added missing packages and fixed CI issues. PR #3909 implemented functionality to set avatars from the assets folder. PR #3907 added GUI thumbnail support, and PR #3902 introduced client WSS (WebSocket Secure) capabilities.
Documentation improvements were also made with PR #3906, which performed a major cleanup of the project's documentation.

Three recent issues have been opened in the ElizaOS GitHub repository:

1. Issue #3904: A suggestion to improve the documentation sitemap.xml priority, submitted by user madjin.

2. Issue #3912: A report that the v2/autodoc fileUsageDoc is missing context, submitted by user jmikedupont2.

3. Issue #3914: A suggestion regarding the usage of typebox for safety, also submitted by user jmikedupont2.

These issues appear to focus on documentation improvements and type safety in the ElizaOS project.

Over the past two days (March 12-14, 2025), the elizaos/eliza repository showed significant development activity. On March 12-13, there were 5 new pull requests with 1 merged, followed by increased activity on March 13-14 with 8 new pull requests and 7 of those being merged. The repository maintained 2 new issues per day throughout this period, with a consistent team of 8 active contributors working on the project.

The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the contributors to the elizaOS/eliza project.
